Tongue Signs: Pale tongue (overall or front 1/3 area), thin coating, possibly dry
Pulse Signs: Weak, thin, empty pulse in right cun position (Lung)
Mechanism/Notes: Lung houses Po (corporeal soul) and governs grief emotion. Front third of tongue = Lung/Heart area. Right cun pulse = Lung position.

Tongue Signs: Pale, possibly swollen tongue body, thin white coating
Pulse Signs: Weak, deficient pulse overall, especially right cun (Lung) and right guan (Spleen)
Mechanism/Notes: Grief depletes Lung Qi, which fails to support Spleen. Pale = Qi/Blood deficiency. Weak pulse at depth = interior deficiency.

Tongue Signs: Pale or normal body, thin coating, may have slight purple tinge indicating stagnation
Pulse Signs: Tight or slightly wiry pulse in right cun (Lung), may be weak
Mechanism/Notes: Lung unable to descend and disperse Qi. Tight pulse = obstruction/pain. Front 1/3 tongue corresponds to chest/upper jiao.

Tongue Signs: Pale tongue, especially front third, scanty coating
Pulse Signs: Weak, thin pulse in right cun (Lung), lacks force
Mechanism/Notes: Lung governs voice and speech. Pale tip/front = Heart-Lung weakness. Weak cun pulse = upper jiao Qi deficiency.

Tongue Signs: Pale tongue overall, thin white coating
Pulse Signs: Floating but weak pulse in right cun (Lung), lacks root
Mechanism/Notes: Lung produces Wei Qi. Floating pulse normally indicates exterior, but weak = deficiency allowing invasion. Spontaneous sweating may accompany.

Tongue Signs: Pale, moist tongue with thin coating
Pulse Signs: Floating weak pulse in right cun, empty quality
TCM Pattern: Lung Qi Deficiency - Wei Qi not consolidating exterior
Mechanism/Notes: Wei Qi fails to secure exterior. Empty pulse = Qi/Yang deficiency. Moisture on tongue = fluids not properly regulated.

Tongue Signs: Red tip (if Heart Fire) OR pale tip (if Heart Qi deficiency), possible trembling
Pulse Signs: Rapid pulse in left cun (Heart) - if excess; or weak rapid if deficiency
TCM Pattern: Heart Qi Deficiency or Heart-Fire disturbing Shen
Mechanism/Notes: Tongue tip = Heart. Red tip = heat/fire. Pale tip = deficiency. Left cun = Heart position. Rapid = heat or anxiety affecting Heart.

Tongue Signs: Red tip with scanty coating (Yin def) OR pale with normal coating (Qi def)
Pulse Signs: Thin, rapid pulse in left cun (Heart) if Yin def; weak pulse if Qi def
TCM Pattern: Heart-Yin Deficiency or Heart-Lung Qi Deficiency
Mechanism/Notes: Shen not rooted. Red tip + no coating = Yin deficiency heat. Pale = Qi deficiency unable to nourish Shen. Thin rapid = Yin def.

Tongue Signs: Red tongue tip, may have red points, possible heart area cracks
Pulse Signs: Wiry and rapid pulse in left cun (Heart), may be thin
Mechanism/Notes: Grief transforms to agitation. Red tip = Heart Fire. Cracks in center = Heart Yin damage. Wiry = constraint, rapid = heat.

Tongue Signs: Pale tongue body, swollen, possible teeth marks, thin coating
Pulse Signs: Weak pulse in left cun (Heart) and right guan (Spleen)
Mechanism/Notes: Heart houses Shen (cognition), Spleen houses Yi (thought). Both depleted. Swollen with teeth marks = Spleen Qi deficiency with dampness.

Tongue Signs: Red tip or sides, may be normal body with red tip
Pulse Signs: Wiry or rapid pulse in left cun (Heart)
Mechanism/Notes: Excessive dreaming = Shen unsettled. Red sides = Liver involvement. Red tip = Heart Fire. Wiry = Liver constraint.

Tongue Signs: Normal or slightly red body with RED SIDES, possible yellow coating if heat
Pulse Signs: WIRY pulse in left guan (Liver), may be rapid if transforming to heat
TCM Pattern: Liver Qi Stagnation transforming to Fire
Mechanism/Notes: Sides of tongue = Liver/Gallbladder. Red sides = Liver Fire. Wiry pulse = classic Liver Qi stagnation sign. Left guan = Liver position.

Grief Symptom: Sighing, feeling of pressure in chest
Tongue Signs: Normal body, may have red sides, coating depends on other factors
Pulse Signs: WIRY pulse, especially left guan (Liver), may extend to other positions
Mechanism/Notes: Sighing = Liver Qi constraint trying to escape. Wiry = tense like guitar string. Liver constraint affects Qi flow throughout body.

Tongue Signs: Red or purple sides of tongue
Pulse Signs: Wiry, tight pulse in left guan (Liver/Gallbladder)
Mechanism/Notes: Sides of tongue directly correspond to Liver/GB channels. Pain in hypochondrium = Liver area. Tight pulse = pain/obstruction.

Grief Symptom: Depression, feeling stuck, inability to move forward
Tongue Signs: Purple, dark, or lavender tongue body; or pale with purple sides
Pulse Signs: Wiry but weak pulse, or deep wiry pulse
TCM Pattern: Liver Qi Stagnation with Blood Stasis or Qi deficiency
Mechanism/Notes: Purple = blood stasis from prolonged stagnation. Deep = interior pattern. Wiry but weak = constraint with underlying deficiency.

Tongue Signs: Purple sides, possible purple spots, dark coating
Pulse Signs: Wiry pulse in left guan (Liver), may be choppy if blood stasis
Mechanism/Notes: Liver regulates menstruation. Stagnation from grief disrupts flow. Choppy pulse = blood stasis. Purple spots = blood stagnation.

Grief Symptom: Poor appetite, no desire to eat
Tongue Signs: Pale tongue with thick white coating in CENTER, possibly swollen
Pulse Signs: Weak, soggy pulse in right guan (Spleen/Stomach)
Mechanism/Notes: Center of tongue = Spleen/Stomach. Thick coating = digestive stagnation. Swollen = dampness. Right guan = Spleen position. Soggy = dampness.

Tongue Signs: Swollen tongue with teeth marks on SIDES/EDGES, thick coating in center
Pulse Signs: Weak and slightly wiry pulse in right guan (Spleen), may be slippery
TCM Pattern: Spleen Qi Deficiency with Liver invading Spleen
Mechanism/Notes: Teeth marks = Spleen Qi too weak to hold tongue shape. Wiry in Spleen position = Liver attacking Spleen. Slippery = dampness/food stagnation.

Tongue Signs: Pale, swollen tongue with thick white coating, teeth marks on edges
Pulse Signs: Weak, soggy or slippery pulse in right guan (Spleen)
Mechanism/Notes: Spleen transforms and transports. Weakness causes dampness and loose stools. Soggy/slippery pulse = dampness. Thick coating = turbid dampness.

Tongue Signs: Pale or slightly red tongue, may have thick coating in center
Pulse Signs: Weak pulse in right guan (Spleen) and left cun (Heart)
Mechanism/Notes: Spleen houses Yi (thought/intention). Overthinking damages Spleen. Heart-Spleen both affected in grief with rumination. Both pulses weak.

Tongue Signs: Swollen pale tongue with greasy coating, possible teeth marks
Pulse Signs: Soggy, slippery pulse in right guan (Spleen)
TCM Pattern: Spleen Deficiency with Phlegm misting mind
Mechanism/Notes: Phlegm obscures clarity. Greasy coating = phlegm-dampness. Swollen tongue = Spleen cannot transform fluids. Slippery = phlegm.

Tongue Signs: Pale tongue with thin or NO coating at ROOT (back of tongue)
Pulse Signs: Deep, weak pulse in both chi positions (Kidneys), especially left chi (Kidney Yin)
TCM Pattern: Kidney Essence Deficiency from prolonged grief
Mechanism/Notes: Root/back of tongue = Kidneys. No coating at root = Kidney Yin severe deficiency. Chi positions = Kidneys. Deep weak = interior deficiency.

Tongue Signs: Pale root (back) of tongue, may be normal body otherwise
Pulse Signs: Weak, deep pulse in chi positions (Kidneys), left and/or right
Mechanism/Notes: Kidneys govern lower back and knees. Root of tongue = Kidney area. Deep = interior. Weak in chi = Kidney deficiency.

Tongue Signs: Pale or red tongue root depending on Yin vs Yang deficiency
Pulse Signs: Weak pulse in left chi (Kidney), may be thin if Yin deficient
Mechanism/Notes: Kidneys open to ears. Essence deficiency from prolonged grief. Thin pulse = Yin/Blood/Essence deficiency. Left chi = Kidney Yin.

Grief Symptom: Fear, feeling afraid, loss of willpower
Tongue Signs: Pale root of tongue, may be wet/moist, possible trembling
Pulse Signs: Deep, weak pulse in chi positions (Kidneys), may be slightly rapid if Heart involvement
Mechanism/Notes: Kidneys house willpower and fear emotion. Prolonged grief depletes Kidneys. Fear replaces sadness. Rapid in Heart but weak in Kidney = disharmony.

Tongue Signs: Red tongue with little to NO coating, especially at ROOT
Pulse Signs: Thin, rapid pulse in left chi (Kidney Yin) and left cun (Heart)
Mechanism/Notes: Night sweats = Yin deficiency cannot control Yang. No coating = severe Yin depletion. Thin rapid = Yin deficiency heat. Root = Kidney area.

Grief Symptom: Chest oppression, feeling of heavy weight on chest
Tongue Signs: Swollen tongue with greasy coating, may have purple tinge
Pulse Signs: Wiry and slippery pulse (Qi stagnation with phlegm)
Mechanism/Notes: Greasy coating = phlegm. Wiry = stagnation. Slippery = phlegm-dampness. Purple = blood stasis from long-term constraint. Affects chest area.

Tongue Signs: Swollen tongue with thick coating at BASE/ROOT, teeth marks
Pulse Signs: Wiry and slippery pulse, may be soggy
Mechanism/Notes: Classic Mei He Qi pattern. Thick coating at root = lower throat involvement. Wiry = constraint. Slippery = phlegm. Cannot swallow or spit out.

Tongue Signs: PURPLE or DARK RED tongue with purple spots, sublingual veins distended
Pulse Signs: CHOPPY or wiry pulse, may be thin
TCM Pattern: Blood Stasis in chest (Xue Fu Yu Xue)
Mechanism/Notes: Purple tongue = blood stasis. Sublingual vein distension = classic blood stasis sign. Choppy pulse = rough, uneven, blood not flowing smoothly.

Grief Symptom: Emotional numbness, inability to feel emotions
Tongue Signs: Pale, dull tongue, may be slightly purple, thin coating or no coating
Pulse Signs: Deep, thin, weak pulse in multiple positions
TCM Pattern: Severe Qi and Blood Deficiency; possible stagnation
Mechanism/Notes: Extreme depletion. Pale = deficiency. Purple tinge = stagnation. Deep = interior. Multiple positions weak = multi-organ involvement. Emotional shutdown.

Grief Symptom: Bitter taste in mouth, dry throat
Tongue Signs: Red tongue with yellow coating, red sides (Liver area)
Pulse Signs: Wiry and rapid pulse in left guan (Liver), may be in other positions
Mechanism/Notes: Grief stagnation transforms to heat. Red sides = Liver Fire. Yellow coating = heat. Bitter taste = Gallbladder heat. Rapid = heat present.

Tongue Signs: Red tongue with scanty coating, dry, cracks possible
Pulse Signs: Thin, slightly rapid pulse in right cun (Lung)
TCM Pattern: Lung Yin Deficiency (dry grief consuming fluids)
Mechanism/Notes: Prolonged grief damages Lung Yin. Dry tongue = fluid deficiency. Scanty coating = Yin damage. Thin rapid = Yin deficiency. Front area = Lung.

Grief Symptom: Cold hands and feet, feeling cold
Tongue Signs: Pale, moist, swollen tongue
Pulse Signs: Deep, slow, weak pulse, especially in chi positions (Kidneys) and right cun (Lung)
Mechanism/Notes: Prolonged grief depletes Yang. Pale, moist, swollen = cold and dampness. Slow pulse = cold. Deep weak = interior Yang deficiency. Chi = Kidney Yang.
